p.s: In the given article Language learning in the UK: 'can't, won't, don't' by John Worne published in The Telegraph on 27 January 2015, the author critizisescriticizes that not enough students in the UK are choosing to study a modern foreign language.
According to the author less and less students in the UK want to study foreign languages.
Eeven though more primary schools are teaching languages now, it is, in the author's opinion, not enough represented.
Worne explains, that that is a huge problem, because the learning of languages is important for the UK, e.g. looking at global trade, national security, diplomacy and in general for businesses.
According to Worne, more and more people from the UK, working in the business industry are using for example translators instead of their skills they could have grown up with.

Furthermore the author informs, that more universities are now offering students the opportunity of studying languages alongside another subject, but in his opinion not enough students are choosing to do so.
More overMoreover the author appeals especially to parents.
He wants them to help their children on the way to study a foreign language.
